# calloutContentForAnnotation(annotation)

**Interface Method**

Returns custom content for the callout bubble.

## Declaration

```swift
calloutContentForAnnotation?(annotation: Annotation): HTMLElement;
```

## Parameters

- **annotation**: The annotation for the callout.

## Return Value

The method returns a DOM element, MapKit JS adds as a subelement of the callout bubble.

## Discussion

You can use this method to provide custom content inside the callout bubble without replacing the whole element, as in [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/AnnotationCalloutDelegate/calloutElementForAnnotation].

When MapKit JS creates a callout for a selected annotation and the annotation’s callout delegate has no [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/AnnotationCalloutDelegate/calloutElementForAnnotation] method, the framework calls [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/AnnotationCalloutDelegate/calloutContentForAnnotation] method instead — if it’s defined — on the delegate with the annotation as a parameter.

## Providing elements

- **calloutElementForAnnotation(annotation)**: Returns an element representing a custom callout.
- **calloutLeftAccessoryForAnnotation(annotation)**: Returns an element to use as a custom accessory on the left side of the callout content area.
- **calloutRightAccessoryForAnnotation(annotation)**: Returns an element to use as a custom accessory on the right side of the callout content area.
